Name: Issue 260
Introduction: It's been a big week with Microsoft Build 2020 happening. Hopefully, you got to join in on the fun - it was amazing.  Microsoft really embraced the idea of a virtual conference.  Don't worry if you missed some of the sessions, you'll find recordings popping up shortly.   The big announcements for Xamarin developers were around the future of .NET and Maui.  I'm looking forward to all these advancements to the platform.  If you aren't sure what I'm talking about then have a look at some links in this week's newsletter. Have a great weekend everyone. ♥ Kym

Articles.Title: Xamarin Updates From Microsoft Build 2020
Articles.Description: A roundup of all the Xamarin related news from Microsoft Build 2020.
Articles.Author: James Montemagno

Articles.Title: Introducing .NET Multi-platform App UI
Articles.Description: Scott Hunter introduces you to what .NET MAUI is, the single project developer experience, modern development patterns, and a look at the journey ahead.
Articles.Author: Scott Hunter

Articles.Title: Model-View-Update (MVU) – How Does It Work?
Articles.Description: MVU (also known as The Elm Architecture) seems to be one of those things which are a mystery to most of us. Until all of a sudden, we understand it and never wanna miss it again. It's something we are all going to want to have a look at given it is supported in Maui.
Articles.Author: Thomas Bandt

Articles.Title: Building a Design System for iOS
Articles.Description: A four-part series about building a Design System for iOS. A practice that helps you improve consistency and quality of your app user experiences.
Articles.Author: Ram Shandilya

Articles.Title: Clearing downloaded Source Link cache for Visual Studio for Mac
Articles.Description: Xamarin.Forms has support for Source Link for a while now. This article dives a little deeper to understand where the cache for it lives on Visual Studio for Mac.
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis

Articles.Title: Add a POSH ADB to your Windows Terminal
Articles.Description: Here is how to setup a Windows Terminal configuration to spin up a new PowerShell, but with ADB support.
Articles.Author: Chris Miller

Articles.Title: Custom Image ProgressBar using SkiaSharp
Articles.Description: Drawing a custom progress image has always been a challenging task as it requires a bit of Math which is not loved by a lot of developers. In this article, we will see how this can be done using c#.
Articles.Author: Ahmed Fouad

Articles.Title: Replicating Flight UI - Part 2
Articles.Description: Leomaris continues here walkthrough of how to create a Xamarin Forms UI.
Articles.Author: Leomaris Reyes

Articles.Title: Handle Multilingual in Xamarin Forms
Articles.Description: If you need multi-lingual support for your Xamarin.Forms app, Charlin shows you her approach. [**Handle Multilingual in Xamarin Forms (Without any plugin)**](https://xamgirl.com/handle-multilingual-in-xamarin-forms-without-any-plugin/) by [Charlin Agramonte](https://twitter.com/Chard003)
Articles.Author: Charlin Agramonte

Articles.Title: First Look at the RadioButton
Articles.Description: Xamarin.Forms 4.6 has a new RadioButton control - check it out. **Note: Post is in Spanish**
Articles.Author: Javier Suárez

Articles.Title: App Themes
Articles.Description: Xamarin.Forms can now respond to the theme changes used by the system and in this article we will see how to do it. **Note: Post is in Spanish**
Articles.Author: Javier Suárez

Articles.Title: iOS Extension for Xamarin.Forms Pages
Articles.Description: iOS extensions allow developers to customize existing system behaviors by adding extra functionality to iOS and macOS Extension Points. Such as custom context actions, password autofill, and incoming calls filters. You can even use these extensions in Xamarin.Forms apps.
Articles.Author: Alexey Strakh

Articles.Title: Protecting Sensitive Data in the Background
Articles.Description: When you switch tasks in iOS the system takes a screenshot of your application, but what if you have data in there that is private.  This article discusses keeping your sensitive data out of the Task Switcher in iOS (Xamarin.Forms). ** Note: Post is in Spanish **
Articles.Author: Vicente Guzman

Articles.Title: Xamarin Forms turns to .NET MAUI – single project and code-base dev experience
Articles.Description: .NET Multi-platform App UI (MAUI) – the effort to turn Xamarin Forms apps use single cross-platform code-base targeting multiple platforms. Demos from Build conference yesterday gave clear signal – it’s not just an experiment but real deal.
Articles.Author: Gunnar Peipman

Articles.Title: Goodbye Xamarin, aloha Maui!
Articles.Description: The news from Build is that Xamarin.Forms is becoming Maui.  Marco discusses.
Articles.Author: Marco

Articles.Title: DevTalk 37 - Building an IoT-enabled prosthetic arm. With Clifford Agius
Articles.Description: Kerry speaks to Clifford Agius about building an IoT-enabled prosthetic arm with a corresponding Xamarin app.
Articles.Author: Kerry Lothrop

Articles.Title: Merge Conflict 202 - Let's Start a Business
Articles.Description: So you want to develop apps.... or sell something... or do anything... you should looking starting an LLC or some sort of business. James and Frank walk you through their journey and James' recent battle with Apple.
Articles.Author: Merge Conflict

Articles.Title: NullPointers Podcast - .NET 5
Articles.Description: With a new version of .NET around the corner, what will it mean for mobile, desktop or library developers. Should you adopt the new Framework?
Articles.Author: Null Pointers

Articles.Title: Using Material Design in Xamarin Forms
Articles.Description: This week Xamarin.Forms 101 looks at how to use the Material Design system in your Xamarin.Forms app.
Articles.Author: Maddy Leger
